caption:
This is an aerial photograph capturing an urban landscape during what appears to be either dawn or dusk, given the muted lighting conditions. The photograph primarily features a complex intersection or series of ramps leading to a large suspension bridge in the background. This bridge spans a wide river visible on the left side of the image, connecting two land masses obscured by haze or mist.

In the foreground, the focal point is a smoothly curved, multi-lane highway interchange dense with traffic. The interchange includes several loops and connecting ramps, showcasing the flow of traffic as vehicles navigate the junction.

Adjacent to the highway, the urban environment is densely packed with rectangular buildings of varied heights. Some of the taller buildings stand out due to their unique architectural designs and heights above the general cityscape. The overall color palette of the scene is shades of blue and green, likely influenced by the lighting and possibly the photograph's age or the film used.

The atmosphere and haze suggest early morning or late evening, adding a layer of tranquility over the bustling city activity. The water body to the left subtly reflects the light, contrasting with the structured urban layout. The entire scene is encapsulated by a somewhat grainy texture, typical of film photography, which adds a vintage or historical feel to the image.
title: Approach to the George Washington Bridge. (From the Sites exhibition. For other images in this assignment, see fiche numbers 98 99.)
